item.title: Coronavirus mutations: Scientists puzzle over impact
item.description: A study has identified a mutation that its authors say could make the coronavirus more infectious.

item.title: Coronavirus: Germany reopens shops as lockdown is relaxed
item.description: Angela Merkel says "the very first phase is behind us" as the coronavirus lockdown is eased.

item.title: Duchess of Sussex reads to Archie on his first birthday
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex reads to her son, in a video to support of Save The Children's coronavirus appeal.

item.title: New Zealand coronavirus: Massive car heist under cover of lockdown
item.description: Thieves used a quiet weekend to steal almost 100 vehicles, shattering New Zealand's sense of community.

item.title: X Æ A-12: Elon Musk and Grimes confirm baby name
item.description: The singer Grimes offers an explanation of the unusual name to her followers on social media.

item.title: Mexico receives ventilator shipment from US
item.description: The 211 machines were purchased from a US firm, Mexico's foreign minister said.

item.title: Millie Small: My Boy Lollipop singer dies aged 72
item.description: The singer, who had Jamaica's first million-selling single, dies after suffering a stroke.

item.title: Coronavirus: Nigeria's death penalty by Zoom 'inhumane'
item.description: A man is sentenced to hang for murder following a virtual court session amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Biden demands justice for Georgia killing of black jogger Arbery
item.description: Ahmaud Arbery, a 25-year-old black man, was confronted by an ex-policeman and his son while jogging.

item.title: Tom Cruise: Filming in space and four of his other memorable stunts
item.description: The actor is well known for his daring stunts, but this takes things to another level.

item.title: Coronavirus: EU facing 'deep and uneven recession'
item.description: The European Commission predicts a decline in economic activity this year of 7.5%.

item.title: Egypt says jailed filmmaker who mocked Sisi died from alcohol poisoning
item.description: Shady Habash, whose video mocked the president, "mistook hand sanitiser for water", prosecutors say.

item.title: Coronavirus: How long it takes to recover
item.description: Weeks, months, even a year - we look at the factors that can affect the time taken to get better.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: India jobless numbers cross 120 million in April
item.description: The data for April shows India's unemployment figures are four times that of the US.

item.title: Grimes and Elon Musk's X Æ A-12 (and 8 other unusual celebrity baby names)
item.description: Grimes and Elon Musk's first child together is hardly the first unusual celebrity baby name.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown: I got a life-changing opportunity
item.description: Ana Carmona was quarantined with her parents and siblings in NYC, when she got some big news.

item.title: Coronavirus: Photographers' children's lives in lockdown
item.description: Photographers who work for Unicef have taken candid shots of their children's lives during lockdown.

item.title: The Aces: 'We were told not to sing about girls'
item.description: The indie-pop band were told to hide their sexuality but their second album joyfully defies the advice.

item.title: Coronavirus and climate change a ‘double crisis’
item.description: Many activists have had to stop their usual work due to the pandemic. Here's how they're responding.

item.title: Five-year-old caught driving parents' car in Utah
item.description: With $3 in his pocket, the Utah boy said he was driving to California to buy a Lamborghini.

item.title: Spin-offs, sequels and stars - Netflix's Tiger King has spawned a monster
item.description: Stars have been falling over themselves to be involved in a string of new scripted adaptations.

item.title: How an Iranian airline helped coronavirus spread
item.description: An investigation by BBC News Arabic has found how one Iranian airline contributed to the spread of coronavirus around the Middle East.

item.title: Coronavirus: When might Hollywood reopen for business?
item.description: Cast and crews might have to quarantine together in the future when filming begins again.

item.title: Dame Judi Dench becomes British Vogue's oldest cover star at 85
item.description: The Oscar-winner says she hopes "a great deal of kindness comes out of this" current global crisis.

item.title: Climate change and coronavirus: Five charts about the biggest carbon crash
item.description: How the global pandemic is limiting carbon emissions and what this will mean for climate change.

item.title: Coronavirus: Sailors tell of months stuck on ships
item.description: Since March, many ports are refusing to allow crew changes or shore leave.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can live-streaming save China's economy?
item.description: In China, the live-streaming industry has become an important platform for economic recovery.

item.title: Scientists explain magnetic pole's wanderings
item.description: The North Magnetic Pole has been racing across the top of the world, from Canada towards Siberia.

item.title: Mozambique: Is Cabo Delgado the latest Islamic State outpost?
item.description: Islamist militants have stepped up attacks in the north, raising fears of greater instability.

item.title: The groundbreaking way to search lungs for signs of Covid-19
item.description: Artificial intelligence technology is being rapidly deployed worldwide to help tackle Covid-19.

item.title: German Bundesliga to resume this month
item.description: Chancellor Angela Merkel confirms the German Bundesliga season can resume this month.

item.title: Premier League season could be cancelled if clubs don't back neutral venues, says managers' union
item.description: The 2019-20 Premier League season could be cancelled if clubs do not agree to play in neutral venues, says LMA chief executive Richard Bevan.

item.title: Coronavirus and sport: Tennis bodies set up fund to support players
item.description: Tennis' governing bodies confirm the creation of a Player Relief programme to support those worst affected by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: 'I love the battle, I have no fear' - Bess on England, the Ashes and enjoying on-field backchat
item.description: Dom Bess talks about England, the Ashes and why he looks up to Australia's Nathan Lyon.

item.title: MOTD podcast: Top 10 Ballon d'Or winners of Premier League era
item.description: The latest MOTD podcast sees the guys discuss the top 10 Ballon d'Or winners of the Premier League era.

item.title: England bad at penalties? Think again - say the Germans
item.description: New scientific research, from Germany of all places, suggests English footballers are actually good at spot-kicks.

item.title: Coronavirus: I watched the president reveal I had Covid-19 on TV
item.description: Against her will, Sita Tyasutami became "case one", the face of Indonesia's coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Coronavirus: How India's lockdown sparked a debate over maids
item.description: The government says domestic helpers can now resume work, but why are some Indians worried?

item.title: Coronavirus: Can you compare the UK with Italy?
item.description: The UK has passed Italy's death toll but it's hard to make direct comparisons.

item.title: Coronavirus: Do not use untested remedies, WHO Africa warns
item.description: The statement comes as Madagascar is promoting a product that has not gone through clinical trials.

item.title: Coronavirus: How to open a hairdressers after lockdown
item.description: Hairdressers can reopen after Germany relaxes its lockdown but there is a long list of rules.

item.title: Emotional abuse: ‘My fiance seemed perfect - but he wanted to control me’
item.description: An actress who became engaged to an older and more successful actor, describes six months of emotional abuse.
